comments.author: myk@mykzilla.org
comments.text:
This is not a web runtime issue, so I'm moving it back to the Untriaged component.

It also isn't a Firefox issue generally, as the error is a server error, so it happens on the server, regardless of which browser you use. (To confirm, load http://chuclone.com/ in Chrome.)
comments.creator: myk@mykzilla.org
comments.raw_text:
This is not a web runtime issue, so I'm moving it back to the Untriaged component.

It also isn't a Firefox issue generally, as the error is a server error, so it happens on the server, regardless of which browser you use. (To confirm, load http://chuclone.com/ in Chrome.)

(In reply to Myk Melez [:myk] [@mykmelez] from comment #3)
> This is not a web runtime issue, so I'm moving it back to the Untriaged
> component.
> 
> It also isn't a Firefox issue generally, as the error is a server error, so
> it happens on the server, regardless of which browser you use. (To confirm,
> load http://chuclone.com/ in Chrome.)

Yes. That is what i was wondering when i read this bug. Normally one would try to check on the other browsers as well before reporting it as a Firefox bug. It isn't a big problem however.

Also, do you know any link which points to the best guidelines for understanding if a particular issue/bug really belongs to Firefox and can be associated with one of the components? This may be useful to new contributors.
